sentences.en: By standing on tiptoe, I can just reach the shelf.
sentences.cn: 跷着脚我刚能够着那个架子.

sentences.en: Don't make any noise. Steal a tiptoe to the door.
sentences.cn: 别作声, 踮着脚儿走到门口那儿.

sentences.en: He discovered that with Miss Daisy Millar there was no great need of walking on tiptoe.
sentences.cn: 他发现,同黛丝·密勒小姐在一起,是无需战战兢兢怀着鬼胎的.

sentences.en: He stood on tiptoe and peeped through one of these windows.
sentences.cn: 他立在一扇这样的窗子前面，踮起脚尖朝里看。

sentences.en: He stood on tiptoe and tried to see over the wall.
sentences.cn: 他踮起脚尖,试图看到墙那边.

sentences.en: I am on the tiptoe of expectation for his coming.
I stood tiptoe upon a little hill.
sentences.cn: 我踮着脚站在一座小山顶上.

sentences.en: Jane stood on tiptoe to kiss him.
My mother would tuck me in, turn out the lights and tiptoe out.
sentences.cn: 母亲会给我掖好被子，关上灯，然后蹑手蹑脚走出去。

sentences.en: She does not tiptoe through life taking cues from others.
sentences.cn: 她从来不依葫芦画瓢小心翼翼地生活.

sentences.en: She had to stand on tiptoe to reach the top shelf.
sentences.cn: 她得踮起脚尖才能够到顶层的架子.

sentences.en: She leaned her bike against the stone wall and stood on tiptoe to peer over it.
sentences.cn: 她把自行车斜靠在石墙上，踮起脚往墙内张望。

sentences.en: She slipped out of bed and tiptoed to the window.
sentences.cn: 她溜下床，踮起脚尖走向窗户。

sentences.en: She walked into the room on tiptoe.
She went away , walking on tiptoe out of the room.
sentences.cn: 她踮着脚尖走出了房间.

sentences.en: Standing on tiptoe , the boy looked over the wall.
The boy stood up tiptoe and reached for the map on the wall.
sentences.cn: 男孩踮着脚,伸出手去拿墙上的地图.

sentences.en: The children were on tiptoe before the birthday party.
sentences.cn: 孩子们都急切地等待着生日晚会的开始

sentences.en: Tiptoe is the most neutral verb.

words.tran_cn: 踮着脚走的；偷偷摸摸的

phrases.phrase: on tiptoe(或 tiptoes)(北美亦作 on one's tiptoes)

trans.tran_cn: 踮着脚走的；偷偷摸摸的

trans.tran_en: If you tiptoe somewhere, you walk there very quietly without putting your heels on the floor when you walk
to walk quietly and carefully on your toes, so that nobody hears you
